subject: Programming
title: Moore's Law
description: Learn Moore's Law in one minute.

hook.text: In 1965, Gordon Moore predicted transistor counts would double roughly every two years.

buildup.text: For decades, his prediction held. Chips got smaller, faster, and cheaper at an exponential rate.

discovery.text: Moore's Law isn't a law of physics. It's a self-fulfilling prophecy the industry chose to chase.

twist.text: Transistors are now just a few atoms wide. Physics is making further shrinking nearly impossible.

climax.text: The era of easy doubling is ending. New approaches like 3D chips and quantum computing are next.

punchline.text: Fifty years of doubling reshaped civilization.

quiz.question: What did Moore's Law predict?
options: Transistor counts double roughly every two years
Software gets twice as complex yearly
